tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE content_files (
    file_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_name VARCHAR(255),
    file_path VARCHAR(255),
    file_size INT,
    upload_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE files (
    id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    file_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    file_path TEXT NOT NULL,
    file_size INT NOT NULL,
    created_at TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE file_tags (
    file_id INT NOT NULL,
    tag_id INT NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY (file_id, tag_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (file_id) REFERENCES files(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (tag_id) REFERENCES tags(id)
);

CREATE TABLE files (
    file_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_name VARCHAR(255),
    file_size INT,
    file_type VARCHAR(50),
    created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
    created_at TIMESTAMP,
    last_login TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE categories (
    category_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    category_name VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    description TEXT,
    created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE file_mappings (
    mapping_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT REFERENCES files(file_id),
    category_id INT REFERENCES categories(category_id),
    created_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE files (
    file_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_name VARCHAR,
    file_type VARCHAR,
    file_size INT,
    file_path VARCHAR
);

CREATE TABLE file_metadata (
    metadata_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    file_id INT,
    category_id INT,
    tag_id INT,
    metadata_value VARCHAR,
    FOREIGN KEY (file_id) REFERENCES files(file_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (category_id) REFERENCES file_categories(category_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (tag_id) REFERENCES file_tags(tag_id)
);
